rules.natural: If radiation treats cancer, then the research is successful.
Assuming the FDA approves chemotherapy, then if it is not the case that treating cancer with chemotherapy leads to successful research, the treatment is not effective.
Under the condition that the FDA approves radiation, then if treating cancer with chemotherapy does not imply successful research, the treatment is not effective.
Whenever chemotherapy is phase 3 successful, then the FDA approves chemotherapy.
Either chemotherapy is phase 3 successful or radiation is phase 3 successful.
Provided that the study publishes results in the journal, then either the NIH receives funding for the study or, if radiation is phase 3 successful, the FDA approves radiation.
Either the study publishes results in the journal or the study presents at the conference.
If the study presents at the conference, then either the NIH receives funding for the study or, under the condition that radiation is phase 3 successful, the FDA approves radiation.
Given that the lab technician observes the cell structure, the research is successful.
If the team applies for a grant from the foundation, then the team seeks grants.
Either the team observes an earthquake in the region or the team receives a report of seismic data.
If the team receives a report of seismic data, then under the condition that the research is not successful, the team halts research.
Whenever the geologist predicts an aftershock, then the geologist warns the authorities.
Either the geologist predicts an aftershock or the geologist models seismic activity.

If the geologist models seismic activity, then assuming the geologist analyzes the seismic data, and if the team observes an earthquake in the region, and provided that the research is not successful, the team halts research.

Given that the geologist warns the authorities, then if the geologist analyzes the seismic data, and if the team observes an earthquake in the region, and under the condition that the research is not successful, the team halts research.
Assuming the lab assistant prepared the sample, then if the lab technician has training in microscopy, and if the lab technician uses the microscope, the lab technician observes the cell structure.
If the lab assistant stained the sample, then the lab assistant prepared the sample.
Either the lab assistant applies the chemical dye or the lab assistant uses the auto stainer.
Provided that the lab assistant uses the auto stainer, then the lab assistant stained the sample.
Either the technician calibrates the microscope or, if the lab assistant applies the chemical dye, then the lab assistant stained the sample.
Either chemotherapy treats cancer or radiation treats cancer.
Provided that it is not true that if the team faces a budget cut then the team does not continue research, then the team applies for a grant from the foundation.
If it is not the case that treating cancer with chemotherapy leads to successful research, then the treatment is effective.
Provided that it is not the case that if the research is not successful then the team halts research, then the team continues research.

(A1 → A2).natural: Whenever the lab technician uses the microscope, then the lab technician observes the cell structure.

(A1 → G).natural: Provided that the lab technician uses the microscope, the research is successful.

(A10 → G).natural: If radiation treats cancer, then the research is successful.

(A12 → (¬(A9 → G) → ¬A11)).natural: Assuming the FDA approves chemotherapy, then if it is not the case that treating cancer with chemotherapy leads to successful research, the treatment is not effective.

(A12 ∨ A13).natural: Either the FDA approves chemotherapy or the FDA approves radiation.

(A13 → (¬(A9 → G) → ¬A11)).natural: Under the condition that the FDA approves radiation, then if treating cancer with chemotherapy does not imply successful research, the treatment is not effective.

(A14 → A12).natural: Whenever chemotherapy is phase 3 successful, then the FDA approves chemotherapy.

(A14 ∨ A15).natural: Either chemotherapy is phase 3 successful or radiation is phase 3 successful.

(A15 → A13).natural: If radiation is phase 3 successful, then the FDA approves radiation.

(A16 ∨ (A15 → A13)).natural: Either the NIH receives funding for the study or, if radiation is phase 3 successful, the FDA approves radiation.

(A17 → (A16 ∨ (A15 → A13))).natural: Provided that the study publishes results in the journal, then either the NIH receives funding for the study or, if radiation is phase 3 successful, the FDA approves radiation.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: Either the study publishes results in the journal or the study presents at the conference.

(A18 → (A16 ∨ (A15 → A13))).natural: If the study presents at the conference, then either the NIH receives funding for the study or, under the condition that radiation is phase 3 successful, the FDA approves radiation.

(A2 → G).natural: Given that the lab technician observes the cell structure, the research is successful.

(A21 → ¬A20).natural: Whenever the team faces a budget cut, then the team does not continue research.

(A23 → A22).natural: If the team applies for a grant from the foundation, then the team seeks grants.

(A24 → (¬G → A19)).natural: Provided that the team observes an earthquake in the region, then if the research is not successful, the team halts research.

(A24 ∨ A25).natural: Either the team observes an earthquake in the region or the team receives a report of seismic data.

(A25 → (¬G → A19)).natural: If the team receives a report of seismic data, then under the condition that the research is not successful, the team halts research.

(A26 → (A24 → (¬G → A19))).natural: Assuming the geologist analyzes the seismic data, then if the team observes an earthquake in the region, and if the research is not successful, the team halts research.

(A27 → (A26 → (A24 → (¬G → A19)))).natural: Provided that the geologist predicts an aftershock, then if the geologist analyzes the seismic data, and if the team observes an earthquake in the region, and if the research is not successful, the team halts research.

(A27 → A29).natural: Whenever the geologist predicts an aftershock, then the geologist warns the authorities.

(A27 ∨ A28).natural: Either the geologist predicts an aftershock or the geologist models seismic activity.

(A28 → (A26 → (A24 → (¬G → A19)))).natural: If the geologist models seismic activity, then assuming the geologist analyzes the seismic data, and if the team observes an earthquake in the region, and provided that the research is not successful, the team halts research.

(A29 → (A26 → (A24 → (¬G → A19)))).natural: Given that the geologist warns the authorities, then if the geologist analyzes the seismic data, and if the team observes an earthquake in the region, and under the condition that the research is not successful, the team halts research.

(A3 → (A1 → A2)).natural: Provided that the lab technician has training in microscopy, then if the lab technician uses the microscope, the lab technician observes the cell structure.

(A4 → (A3 → (A1 → A2))).natural: Assuming the lab assistant prepared the sample, then if the lab technician has training in microscopy, and if the lab technician uses the microscope, the lab technician observes the cell structure.
